Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘City-Zuke’ offers the quintessential, versatile zucchini flavour: a mild, slightly sweet and nutty profile that readily absorbs other flavours. The fruits are a deep emerald green, straight, and glossy, typically growing to 15-18 cm in length while remaining tender and seedless. The plant’s form is its key innovation - a dense, open bush with short internodes and upright leaves, reaching only 45 cm in diameter and requiring no trailing.

2. The Compact Summer Squash Workhorse This zucchini’s value is in its space efficiency and classic culinary performance.

  • Grilled or Sautéed: Sliced into rounds or planks, it grills and sautés beautifully, developing a sweet, caramelized exterior while staying firm and tender.
  • Zucchini Noodles (“Zoodles”): Its straight, uniform shape and firm texture make it ideal for spiralizing into a low-carb, gluten-free pasta alternative.
  • Baking and Fritters: Grated, it is perfect for moist zucchini bread, muffins, or crispy fritters, where its mild flavour acts as a perfect canvas for spices and herbs.
  • Stuffed Zucchini Boats: The smaller, tender fruits are excellent for halving and stuffing with grains, meats, and cheeses for a complete meal.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘City-Zuke’ is a continuously productive plant. For the best texture and flavour, harvest fruits frequently when they are young and skin is still glossy. Supplied as an RFID-tagged seedling plug, a single plant provides a surprisingly abundant and steady yield, producing 8-12 tender fruits over the main season, with the first harvest ready for picking approximately 50 days from transplant.
